introduction.p:
Here are the definitions of even and odd.
An integer n \in \mathbb{Z} is even when there exists k \in \mathbb{Z} such that n = 2k.
An integer n \in \mathbb{Z} is odd when there exists k \in \mathbb{Z} such that n = 2k+1.

Here are the definitions of divisible and not divisible. Let n,d \in \mathbb{Z} be integers.
We say that d \mid n when there exists k \in \mathbb{Z} such that n=dk.
Otherwise, we say that d \nmid n. This means that n \neq dk for all k \in \mathbb{Z}.
Use these definitions to prove the following statements.

statement.p: Prove that for all integers n \in \mathbb{Z}, if n is odd, then 5n + 3 is even.

solution.p:
We have n=2r+1 for some r \in \mathbb{Z}. Therefore
5n+3 = 5(2r+1)+3 = 10r+8 = 2(5r+4).
Taking s=5r+4, we have 5n+3=2s, which proves that 5n+3 is even.

statement.p: Prove that if n \in \mathbb{Z}, then 5n^2+3n+7 is odd.

solution.p: There are two cases: when n is odd and when n is even.

Case 1: n is odd. We have n=2r+1 for some r \in \mathbb{Z}. Therefore
5n^2+3n+7 & = 5(2r+1)^2+3(2r+1)+7 = (20r^2 + 20r+ 5) + (6r+3) + 7
& = 20r^2 + 26r+15 = 2(10r^2+13r+7) +1.
Taking s=10r^2+13r+7, we have 5n^2+3n+7=2s+1, which proves that 5n^2+3n+7 is odd.

Case 2: n is even. We have n=2r for some r \in \mathbb{Z}. Therefore
5n^2+3n+7 = 5(2r)^2+3(2r)+7 = 20r^2 + 6r + 7 = 2(10r^2+3r+3) +1.
Taking s=10r^2+3r+3, we have 5n^2+3n+7=2s+1, which proves that 5n^2+3n+7 is odd.

statement.p: Prove that if a is any odd integer and b is any even integer, then 2a+3b is an even integer.

solution.p:
We have a=2r+1 for some r \in \mathbb{Z}, and b=2s for some s \in \mathbb{Z}. Therefore
2a+3b = 2(2r+1) + 3(2s) = 4r+6s+2 = 2(2r+3s+1)
Taking t=2r+3s+1, we have 2a+3b=2t, which proves that 5n^2+3n+7 is even.

statement.p: Prove that if a is any odd integer and b is any even integer, then a^2+b^2 is an odd integer.

solution.p:
We have a=2r+1 for some r \in \mathbb{Z}, and b=2s for some s \in \mathbb{Z}. Therefore
a^2 + b^2 = (2r+1)^2 + (2s)^2 = 4r^2 + 4r + 4s^2 + 1 = 2(2r^2+ 2r+2s^2) +1
Taking t=2r^2+ 2r+2s^2, we have a^2+b^2=2t+1, which proves that 5n^2+3n+7 is odd.

statement.p: Use a proof by contrapositive to show that for all integers m,n \in \mathbb{Z}, if mn is even then m is even or n is even.

solution.p:
The contrapositive of the statement is: if m is odd and n is odd then mn is odd. Let's prove this statment. We have m=2r+1 and n=2s+1 for some r,s \in \mathbb{Z}. Then
mn = (2r+1)(2s+1) = 4rs+2r+2s+1 = 2(2rs+r+s)+1.
Taking t=2rs+r+s, we have mn= 2t+1 and therefore mn is odd. We have proved the contrapositive, so the original statement is also true (because an implication and its contrapositive have the same truth values).

statement.p: Use a proof by contradiction to show that for any integer n \in \mathbb{Z}, we have 4 \nmid n^2-2.

solution.p: Assume for the sake of contradiction (AFSOC) that 4 \mid n^2-2. This means that n^2-2 = 4k for some k \in \mathbb{Z}. We have two cases.

Case 1: n is odd. We have n=2r+1 for some r \in \mathbb{Z}. We now have
(2r+1)^2-2 & = 4k
4r^2+4r-1 & = 4k
4r^2+4r-4k & = 1
2(2r^2+2r-2k) & = 1
2r^2+2r-2k & = \frac{1}{2}
which is a contradiction because the left hand size is an integer, while the right hand side is not. Therefore 4 \nmid n^2-2 when n is odd.

Case 2: n is even. We have n=2r for some r \in \mathbb{Z}. We now have
(2r)^2-2 & = 4k
4r^2-2 & = 2k
4r^2-4k & = 2
2(r^2-k) & = 1
r^2-k & = \frac{1}{2}
which is a contradiction because the left hand size is an integer, while the right hand side is not. Therefore 4 \nmid n^2-2 when n is even.

statement.p: Prove the following statement using either proof by contrapositive, or proof by contradiction.
For positive integers a,b,n \in \mathbb{N}, if ab = n, then either a \geq \sqrt{n} or b \geq \sqrt{n}.

solution.p: Here is a proof by contrapositive. We must prove that if a < \sqrt{n} and b < \sqrt{n} then ab \neq n.

So assume that a < \sqrt{n} and b < \sqrt{n}. We have
ab < \sqrt{n} \cdot \sqrt{n} = n.
Now, we have ab < n, so of course ab \neq n. We have proved that the contrapositive statement is true, so the original implication is true as well.
